page.title: 15George & Dragon Public House
page.content: The George and Dragon which was built in the early 1900's is owned by Mr.and Mrs.D.Johnson. A most unusual feature of the pub is that as well as being a drinking and eating place,it has a post office attached and two petrol pumps on the forecourt. It is a very popular local inn which provides bar meals at lunchtimes and during the evenings.Two guest rooms upstairs can provide bed and breakfast accommodation.The inn enters teams in the dominoes and darts leagues which begin in September and end in April. They compete against other teams from public houses in Teesdale.Winners receive either a shield or small cup. A team chosen from the regulars also enters the quoits league.A summer activity,home matches are played on two pitches beside the village green.
